txt.en: 'A good distance to the south, nestled between the Loudwater and Hoarwell rivers, there is a wooded and rock-studded land known to those who dwell there as the Angle of Mitheithel.\n\n'Will you venture there and learn if all is well in that place? The Angle has a tumultuous history, and I would not have those days return if they might be prevented by safe-guarding its people.'
Elladan has come to Gaerond, in the Angle.
Elrohir is concerned the safety of the Angle might be threatened.

'My brother was right to ask us to come here, [placeholder]. I cannot long stay, but what I have seen reveals that the land is unsettled. Something stirs in the wild.\n\n'The land between the rivers is not densely populated, but the folk here must be protected. Can I ask you to do this?'
'Will you venture south to the Angle and learn if all is well? That land has a tumultuous history, and I would not have those days return if they might be prevented by safe-guarding its people.'
Journey to the camp-site at Gaerond, in the Angle of Mitheithel
The small camp-site at Gaerond is located south of the Trollshaws, in the northern reaches of the Angle.
